alert.note: Alert for Hunterdon; Morris; Sussex; Warren (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 26 at 7:26PM EDT until June 26 at 9:30PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR WEST CENTRAL MORRIS, CENTRAL HUNTERDON, SOUTHWESTERN SUSSEX, AND CENTRAL WARREN COUNTIES... At 726 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.5 to 1 inch in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other drainage and low lying areas. Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Hopatcong, Hackettstown, Washington, High Bridge, Stanhope, Netcong, Clinton, Harmony, Oxford, Alpha, Glen Gardner, and Hampton. This includes the following highways... Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 19. Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 15 and 28. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.5-1 INCH IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
